messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 2966
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/30/2003 4:06:04 PM Central Standard Time, ... My husband used to freak about the piano and violin music, the laughter (or screams of
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/30/2003 4:06:04 PM Central Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

> I think that depends on the person and occupation. With my husband's line of
>
> work, it would seem very unprofessional to most. I just can't see most
> people he's looking for taking him seriously with kids laughing in the
> background.
>

My husband used to freak about the piano and violin music, the laughter (or
screams of outrage; sister-wars <g>), the barking dog....Until I convinced
him that the Family Noise could be considered a Litmus Test for Cool People,
Feminists, and those supporting Family Leave. The offended he wouldn't want
to work with, anyway, right? :-D

Becky in Iowa


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
